column1: Little Goat Diner////I am a bit suprised to see people knocking the food for being "a la carte".  Yeah
column2: I understand it's a $12 sandwich with no sides
column3: but I can tell you that my Tonkatsu sandwich was HUGE and definately worth $12 (it was AWESOME!).  In fact
column4: I ordered a side of garlic mashed potatoes (which were delicious)
column5: but I didn't even need them.  I ended up taking half the sandwich and half the potatoes home.  Granted
column6: I also had a cup of the soup of the day (amazing) and some of the pickled onion rings (the curried mayo served with these is the BOMB.  I could eat it every day).
